99501.name: Deathtrap Raider
99501.description:
From the Background:

The sky exploded as a portal opened. By finding the ancient spell book of Analand, Mara has learned how to use ZED and teleport. She is visiting old Allansia, the Chiang Mai area. A helicopter comes down through the portal and hovers there over the mounds of snow before landing. Snow is whirled and blown everywhere because of the propellers. Mara gets out dressed in her tight thermal suit and furry-collared trench coat. With her rucksack of equipment, she leaves from the chopper and hikes it down the mountain pass as her rides returns to the teleport.

She arrives at the doors of the death-trap Dungeon and inserts a diamond into the lock, locks click in succession, and the doors open. What comes out is cold stale air.

Lighting her large glow stick she sets foot inside.

Dull crystals light up and give off a dull light just enough for her to see a bit down the Northern tunnel.

The mission is to attain a blue diamond rumoured to be in the cavern of the Dungeon. She plans on stealing it, returning to her time and auctioning it off to the modern world. Although she has travelled back in time, the dangers are still real in this present time. She has arrived long after the Trial of Champions number 4.

99502.name: Deathtrap Overlord
99502.description:
From the Background:

You are deep within the bowels of the infamous Deathtrap Dungeon. Your smoky torch reveals little before you except the continuation of this grime incrusted tube. You know with absolute certainty that you are finally nearing the exit. You must continue. Read on...

99503.name: Doom Demon
99503.description:
From the Background:

You find yourself slowly meandering through a large leafy forest on a hot summer's day. The woods you seem to be exploring are always welcoming, more so during the height of summer; and it was certainly that blessed time of year! The trees surrounding you stretched on endlessly. They seemed young and strong, and had a healthy canopy of rich green leaves surmounting them. The grass at your feet is thick and lightly dipped in morning due. Above you, streaming through countless branches, lays the round of the sun, as it climbs peacefully into the bright blue sky. You walk on through the trees, breathing in fresh air scented with roses and other wild flowers that just sway lazily about you. A slight sound catches your ear and, upon locating its source, you discover it to be a pair of bees gently floating through the air. Then you notice the other sounds about you: birds singing, crickets playing their strange tunes and even the odd frog doing its best to add to the forest chorus.

Things change after a few moments though: the birds cease their calls, as do the insects; even the wind seems quiet. Then the forest around you quickly darkens and chills you. The wind becomes much stronger and dislodges a hail of leaves from the dark woods surrounding you; as if the trees themselves were crying.

So there you stand, alone in the dark, and being taunted by a biting wind and an insurmountable whirl of leaves. Then a cold fear sweeps over you as you notice five dark figures standing silently in the undergrowth ahead of you, and each one of them has their shadowy face tilted in your direction. You stand rooted to the spot, terrified of the nonspeaking forms watching you. You notice that the middle figure stands slightly ahead of the others - perhaps he is their leader? Although you are afraid and seem unable to run or even turn away from the silent group facing you, curiosity still forces you to make a cursory examination of them. None of them appears particularly tall, though they do all seem to be of roughly the same height and, in fact, roughly the same build too. It is about now that you make a chilling discovery because, although the silent group are shrouded in shadows, you can still make out some sort of metal glinting on both their hands and their faces!

You awake bathed in sweat and visibly shaking. You look about you and are glad to find yourself back in the familiar surroundings of your dark bedroom, replete with wardrobe, chest of drawers and, of course, your bed! You sit up and examine the clock beside you - 12:01 am. This is unusual; you have only been asleep for a solitary hour, yet you don't feel remotely tired. You decide to get up, throw some clothes on to protect you from the winter's cold, and head down stares for a little something to eat.

Once down stairs you grab a little snack from the fridge and walk through your dark lounge to turn your TV on, but the only thing that lights its screen is static - on every stinking channel! The aerial must be down, you muse. Never mind though, there's always the good old radio. So you quickly locate it and switch it on, only to be met by white noise - on every blasted channel! What the heck is going on? You flit to the light switches to help illuminate matters, but none of the bulbs seem to work! This is getting ridiculous.

You grab your snack and head back through the shadows, upstairs to your bedroom. Once there, you greedily wolf down the meagre offerings you had previously discovered, then decide to let in a little moonlight by opening your curtains. What you see makes you gasp in shock.

99504.name: Escape Neuburg Keep
99504.description:
From the Background:

You wake up from a dream in which you were being eaten by a ghoul. All you can remember was hardly being able to breathe, paralysed, and trapped in a cold vault lit by one old candle. This creature that resembled a normal human being at one time was dragging itself on its stomach toward you. Its fingernails were overgrown and stained with old blood and dirt. Its face, and its flesh was grey, and there were dark blemishes blotched across its back from when it had died. The mortis stains hadn't cleared away from beneath its wrinkled skin. All you can recall from this nightmare was its teeth biting into your forearm, your blood leaking out on the floor, and your muscles being gnawed on desperately. The sound of the ghoul biting down onto your forearm bone was what woke you up. The crunch... the gurgling... the hissing delight of laughter...

Fighting off the pit of nausea, you peer around the room you're currently in. Your head is throbbing in pain. It appears to be a cell or a dungeon. Insects scuttle across the floor away from you back into the dark shadows as you come to. Some light from the moon outside is shining in through the barred slit which makes the window, even if you wanted to escape using the window, you wouldn't even be able to fit your head through it. There is a large, heavy door with iron grates set into the stone wall ahead of you. It has no handle, only a tiny keyhole, and a square window with three thick bars across it.

Whoever put you in here had made the intention clear that they did not want you to escape while in their absence. When the headache subsides you are able to get to your feet without suffering from too much dizziness. There is no bedding in here, but unknown lumps in the inky corners, and what looks like straw strewn about. There's another cell door across from your room, and you cannot see anything else left or right but tunnel. There is no noise either. The place is silent.

99505.name: Escape from Phrodite
99505.description:
From the Background:

Your world once was a place of freedom. Free thought however lead to conflict between the powerful states of the world, this of course lead to war. As world wars waged the wealthy became poorer as governments drained their income to fund their machines of war. Unhappy with their loss the one hundred wealthiest individuals in the world gathered together and formed the Governmental Planetary Contingent (GPC). Their goal: to maintain wealth and luxury through times of war.

As the Great War waged the GPC had no trouble increasing their wealth by offering support to opposing nations. Slowly the GPC drained the whole world of its riches. War soon ended separating the nation into two distinct classes the GPC and the ruined states that remained after the war. The GPC settled on the one piece of land in the world untouched by war - The Phrodite Coast.

Here the GPC set to work creating holiday resorts called institutes. Here members of the GPC could find an escape from the economy and boredom of business. However ten years after the opening of Aphrodite (the first institute) the employees of the GPC rebelled taking over the institute and converting it to a military base. It was with this event that the first ever Warlord declared war on the GPC.

Unequipped for war the GPC saw one solution, to recreate the reasons for fighting. Supplies and weapons were sent out to key individuals in the ruined states who immediately started to gather forces and fight for the resources and rewards offered by the GPC. As Aphrodite lay in the hands of terrorists the GPC, safely at home in their capital at the far north of the Phrodite coast, funded the ruined states warlords more and more. Eventually Aphrodite was attacked and a ruined state warlord took control. By this time the GPC had researched methods of mind control and were able to come up with an addictive pill entitled "The Bless" this would help them retake their prize institute.

The Bless not only allowed the easy control of a large mass of people but it also took away their freedom and control making them slaves of the GPC. Slowly the Bless was introduced to Aphrodite and order was eventually restored. The Phrodite Coast was reopened as the luxury resort it was meant to be some thirty years ago.

Things were working out as planned, the world was at war and the GPC was profiting from selling weapons and goods. One problem arose however; the Bless took incredible amounts of raw resources to be created. These resources were found almost everywhere but the Phrodite coast. As a solution The Bless was introduced to the ruined states, its addictiveness drove the warlords to mine the raw resources needed and exchange them to the GPC for fresh doses of the pill. The GPC was on top again watching the warlords fight among themselves while they sat in luxury in their institutes, gods to their Blessed slaves.

Soon warlords started to become upset by the zombie like effect of the Bless on their troops and a treaty was made among fifty percent of the warlords to ban the pill. This treaty was the start of the Free worlds Government, a group of warlords apposed to and obsessed with the destruction of the GPC.

Today the GPC owns eight institutes along the Phrodite coast. Each under the control of the Blessers: GPC head officers. The Blessers are in competition with one another as the GPC tends to offer more funds and support to those institutes they deem best. Of course the Blessers themselves never take the Bless but are in control of its distribution. Apart from Blesser competition, the Free worlds constantly raid institutes destroying as much of the Bless as they can. The Free worlds have two major goals at the current time, to destroy the GPC and find a cure to the addictive Bless.

You are an employee of the GPC but your life is about to change! Over the last few weeks you have been questioning yourself, questioning the Bless and doubting your wealthy masters...

99506.name: Escape from Oblivion
99506.description:
From the Background:

The people of Brice do not have much imagination when it comes to names. Their main port is a ramshackle, Byzantine morass of back streets, dead end alleys and bizarre twists and turns, so they call it the City of Mazes. They build a university and town serving it and call it Quill. And they build a massive walled redoubt from which foreigners are barred and call it the Forbidden Fortress.

However, you had to admire their black sense of humour. Their largest prison camp is one in which people simply fade away, forgotten by the outside world, unmourned by all. And they call it Oblivion.

Of course, as you grew up in Royal Lendle you had no thoughts of ever entering Oblivion. But you were born at an unfortunate time. As you hit early adulthood Brice's continuous threats on the borders could not be ignored and you were called into the Gallantarian army. You showed a natural aptitude for leadership in your training and were rapidly promoted to a leading command position within your regiment.

However your first taste of action proved disastrous. Your country was ill-prepared, you realize, there was no overall defensive plan and the superbly oiled Brician machine and the army was swept deep into its own territory. Fortunately the Bricians outran their supply lines and had to halt. In the meantime, your troop was sent in advance to prise out a Brician regiment. Although you and your men fought well, you were caught outnumbered and outsourcered and as a result large numbers were captured. The Bricians, cock-a-hoop with their early war success, sent you – with your commanding officer and a thousand men – to the square, black stone walled incarceration of Oblivion.

Three years on, you muse, as you scratch the date on the wall of your communal cell. The 30 foot long wooden hut is the home to 100 men, there are a dozen others in the camp more or less full. There are 657 men left still alive. There is little news of the war. Occasionally you hear whispers from the Bricians, they are not optimistic. The guards are being changed with alarming regularity now. Many of the replacements are carrying wounds. You shudder every time you consider how Gallantaria is surviving under such an onslaught.

Maybe the war will be over soon, you muse. The Bricians are brutal and ruthless, but they do not simply kill their prisoners without good reason. Of course a Brician good reason can be refusing to obey an order, or trying to escape, or insulting a Brician soldier, but your commanding officer has instructed your men to keep quiet and ride it out. Eventually you will be returned home, to a free Gallantaria.

You hope.

99507.name: Feathers of the Phoenix
99507.description:
From the Background:

You press Vincenzo against the wall and punch him across the face again. He gives a short cry of pain and falls to the floor, his mouth drooling blood. You hear Vortigen snickering behind you and you smile as you give Vincenzo a hearty kick in the ribs.

"If you've come to kill me, then finish the job!", he gasps. You give him a cold stare and smile at him.

"If Branno wanted you dead, you would be", you gloat, "but as it happens he doesn't want to lose such a valuable friend as you just yet. Consider this your warning", you finish with another hearty kick in the ribs. Vortigen continues to guffaw at Vincenzo's plight.

Branno, one of Port Blacksand's most powerful and feared crime lords, had asked the two of you to teach Vincenzo a lesson after Branno discovered he had been embezzling some of the money made from burglaries. It strikes you as odd that Branno did not simply wish him dead, he is not known for his mercy and you and Vortigen have killed for him many times before. Perhaps he simply did not want to lose such a competent bookkeeper. Regardless, the job is done now and Vortigen is eagerly going through Vincenzo's drawers in the hope of finding, what he calls his "Hard Work Bonus". Sadly, there only seems to be a few trinkets of little value, hardly the biggest haul you've ever had. Disappointedly Vortigen continues his rummage... and finds something. From the very back of a small cupboard he pulls out a red feather, glowing faintly in the dim light. On seeing what Vortigen has uncovered Vincenzo awakens out of his dazed stupor and gives a start.

"Leave that alone!" he cries.

"Why? What is it?" demands Vortigen. Vincenzo refuses to answer and gives you a defiant look. However, the fat bookkeeper has been trying your patience too long and you give him a few good kicks to get him talking.

"You can't kill me!" he cries as your kicks break his ribs, "You said so yourself. I'll not talk. You can only hurt me so much without killing me."

"You'd be surprised what you can live through", you reply curtly, drawing your knife and glancing at his ear menacingly. This is more than the cowardly bookkeeper can bear. He reveals that the feather Vortigen is holding is that of a Phoenix, a legendary bird with supposed powers of rebirth. Apparently if four such feathers are collected, it will reveal the location of the phoenix egg, a treasure much more valuable than any gold, as anyone with a phoenix as their pet will gain eternal life.

"I know that one such feather is possessed by the merchant Sylees in Blacksand itself", Vincenzo continues. "I had hoped to acquire all four and get my hands on that Phoenix Egg, but you have put paid to my aspirations." The bookkeeper hangs his head dejectedly and you guess that this is all he knows. With a nod and a cruel smile, you and Vortigen leave his house to the murky Blacksand street outside.

"It appears that we are about to embark on quite a quest", says Vortigen with a devilish glint in his eye. You agree that you should both try to track down the remaining feathers, but one of you should report to Branno first to tell him that Vincenzo has been taken care of for it would not be wise to have an angry Branno on their tails during this enterprise. Vortigen agrees and says he will take the feather and discover the whereabouts of this Sylees, while you report to Branno. You can then meet at the Red Lantern Tavern on Gallows Street at eleven o' clock to discuss your next actions. You concur, and set off towards Branno's headquarters, eager to begin your hunt for the feathers of the phoenix.

99508.name: Tales from the Wild Blue Yonder: Appendix
99508.description:
From the Introduction:

What is this?

A setting and rules companion to Lady Blackbird.




Who is this for?

Anyone who enjoys Lady Blackbird or other Tales from the Wild Blue Yonder.
Anyone interested in fantasy steampunk adventure role-play.




Why do you use this?

Extending or augmenting the adventures of Lady Blackbird and associates.
Having other exciting adventures in the Blue.
Writing new chapters of Tales from the Wild Blue Yonder.




Where and when do you use this?

At the table, when you play.




How do you use this?

Find bits of setting detail to add into your game.
As a GM: find ideas for obstacles, questions, and NPCs.
As a player: find ideas for your character, places to go, and things to do.
Ignore what you don't like and - probably - what contradicts what you do like.

99509.name: Fish Or Cut Bait
99509.description:
This is a game about a fishing competition. Players toss a die to move around the board as they attempt to land on the best fishing holes. Randomly drawn fish cards indicate the weight of the trophy fish. Cards are kept secret from the other players during the competition. Players must also head for the bait shop in order to keep fishing. The game ends after a player reaches the dock... points are scored for the weight of each trophy fish and the player with the most points is declared the winner.

Includes the board, six tokens, fish cards, bait markers, a die, and the rules.

99510.name: The Game of French History
99510.description: 72 Cards. Each one summarises an event in the life of a French King. Players must fill in the blanks. Answers supplied in an accompanying booklet.

99511.description:
Players take turns rolling the die, and stacking either towers of fruit (game 1) or just the fruit itself (game 2.)

Dexterity game similar to Jenga and Bandu with very nice wood pieces shaped like fruit.

Pieces are selected according to the result of the die roll.
99511.name: Tower of fruits

99512.name: Numa
99512.description: Numa is an abstract strategy game in which players use simultaneous movement to try to get pieces adjacent to each other on an 8x8 board. The pieces are in four shapes (triangle, square, circle, and pentagon) and have an Arabic number on one side and a Roman numeral on the other. Movement is done by revealing a colored stone that indicates the direction that the chosen piece will move in. If the adjacent pieces are showing the same number style on their face-up side, they score the total value of the showing numbers. One player scores points for Arabic number matches and the other for the Roman Numeral matches. The first player to 30 points is the winner.

99513.name: Missile Match
99513.description: Missile Match is an abstract strategy game in which players use simultaneous movement to try to get four pieces adjacent to each other (orthogonally or diagonally) on a 4x8 board. Players randomly draw four dominoes and place them face down along the edge of the game board to "launch" missiles onto the playing field. The dominoes are revealed simultaneously. The number on the far side of the domino is the power of the missile and the number on the near side of the domino (closest to the player) is the distance the missile fires. If two missiles land on the same space, the one with the higher power wins and knocks the other one of the board. Blank spaces on dominoes allow for players to remove an opponents piece. The first person to get four missiles in a row in the playing area is the winner.

99514.name: Nelaxtam
99514.description: Nelaxtam is an abstract strategy game in which players are trying to land troops on an island, represented by a 12x12 board. Each space on the board is marked with a white or black marker and the goal is to destroy your opponents territory and remove those markers from the board. Troop movement and action is revealed simultaneously by both players. Troops can either move or destroy an adjacent enemy territory. The game is over once one player cannot position any of his five troops in a position to destroy further enemy territory. The player who has removed the most enemy territory is the winner.

99515.name: Noort River Fur Traders
99515.description: The winter ice will soon be swept out of the Noort River, and the new trading season for furs will will begin. All winter, Indians have been trapping beaver and other fir-bearing animals. They are now on their way to Dutch Fort Orange, 150 miles north of New Amsterdam, with bundles of pelts for sale. You have stocked your sturdy ship with a selection of desirable trade goods, welcome to both settlers and Indians alike. Your task is to sail to Fort Orange, selling your trade goods at a profit along the way, arriving at Fort Orange ready to buy furs. Time is precious as you look for the best price to buy, then sailing back to New Amsterdam (or New England) to sell your cargo of furs at a profit.

99517.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 44 - 2005)
99517.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of the Modern Dispatch features five short adventure outlines for RPGObjects' Blood and Vigilance. The adventure outlines were written to inspire both quick encounters and full-length adventures in the GM's campaign. As with all game material - and especially adventure supplements - the information in this PDF should be rewritten and modified as the GM sees fit. These are not rigid plots that must be followed but, rather, simply suggestions for adventures and distractions during a larger adventure.

99518.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 45 - 2005)
99518.description:
From Introduction:

Pinebox Pawn: This small shop is located in downtown Pinebox on Monument Street. The small door is green, with a tarnished brass doorknob and little panes of glass forming a half-sun motif at the top. Through a large window to the right of the doorway, you can see two mannequins, one male and one female, dressed in clothing from the 1920s or 30s. The window has a small sign hanging on the inside which reads, "We buy and sell everything your heart desires!"

99519.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 46 - 2005)
99519.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Modern Dispatch provides Modern D20 GMs with two pulp villains, fully statted and ready to use, complete with adventure hooks!

The Master of the World is a mysterious figure who claims to be one of the Hidden Masters of Tibetan legend, and who rules a vast criminal empire from a mountaintop fortress in the Himalayas! Rumor has it, however, that he is not Tibetan, but a European...

and...

Doctor Sin, the Devil of Chinatown, is a notoriously brilliant physician, chemist, scientist and master of mesmerism, whose fingers stretch into opium trade, slavery and more! His network of spies and servants include the fearsome Qing Ri assassins, murderous fanatics whose lives are completely subject to their insidious master's will!

99520.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 47 - 2005)
99520.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tortuga is an island in the Caribbean that was home to pirates in the 1600s. As mankind set sail to the stars, pirates followed. In honor of Isla Tortuga, New Tortuga was named and founded as a port of call for those who walk the seamier side of life.

New Tortuga utilizes Merchants, Pirates and Smugglers and Prometheus Rising, but can be used standalone with a little modification.

99521.name: Brain Games
99521.description:
User Summary

A set of games that utilize the Keyboard Controllers.

Touch Me (1 or 2 players)

The players must correctly repeat a sequences of tones. The sequence gets long with each attempt. The game ends after one player has entered four incorrect sequences, or once both players have completed a full 32 tone sequence.

Count Me (1 or 2 players)

The gameplay is similar to Touch Me, except that a sequence of numbers must be repeated rather than a sequence of tones.

Picture Me (1 player)

Four objects are briefly displayed on the screen in a specific order. The player then has 20 seconds to correctly replicate the order in which the objects were displayed.

Find Me (1 or 2 players)

Four objects are displayed on the screen. All but one are identical. The player scores points by identifying the dissimilar object as quickly as possible.

Add Me (1 or 2 players)

Four or five numbers are displayed on the screen. The players must enter the sum of the numbers before a time limit expires.

Play Me

Pressing the keys on the keyboard controller will produce various tones. The game manual lists the key combinations to play the songs Happy Birthday, Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, Three Blind Mice, and a "two-player" medley of Row Your Boat.

99522.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 48 - 2005)
99522.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of the Modern Dispatch features the Mad Dogs, a mercenary company known for taking on assignments that other mercs turn down. Includes information on incorporating the mercs in your campaign, involving the players, and a breakdown of the company's organization.

99523.name: Eden - World Builder
99523.description:
Explore a vast pristine world of infinite possibility. Build your own personal Eden. Eden brings the creative block building genre, pioneered by games like Minecraft, Infiniminer, and Blockland, to the touch screen.

Features:

Unique, beautifully generated worlds to explore, build, and destroy
Reshape nature itself or build man made wonders from dozens of block types
Share your work and explore worlds created by others with integrated community tools
Enjoy the awesome power of destruction with explosives and fire
Intuitive controls designed for multitouch




Source: The Game Website.

99524.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 49 - 2005)
99524.description:
From publisher blurb:

Night Lights is an encounter designed for the Pinebox campaign setting. Alternate leads and hooks for use in other modern-world campaigns are provided for your convenience.

99525.name: Modern Dispatch (Issue 50 - 2005)
99525.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 50th issue of Modern Dispatch provides Modern D20 Game Masters with an organization that is perfect for super-spy adventures and campaigns!

AEGIS - The Agency for Emergency Global Intelligence and Security - is a private, extranational corporation which was founded to combat extranational threats, in a world where billionaire madmen with their own private armies are no longer the stuff of far-fetched spy movies.

The issue features details on the organization (using the Open Content organization rules featured in sources like OGL Horror, 13 Conspiracies, and Adamant's own Pulp Villains: Thugee), adventure hooks, and more!

99526.name: Empire Earth: Gold Edition
99526.description:
Empire Earth, also known as EE, is a real-time strategy computer game developed by Stainless Steel Studios and released on November 23, 2001. It is the first game in the Empire Earth series. It has been described as very similar to the Age of Empires series, and received positive reviews.

The game requires players to collect resources to construct buildings, produce citizens, and conquer opposing civilizations. Empire Earth spans 500,000 years of world history, which is divided into 14 epochs, beginning with the prehistoric age, and ending with the nano age.

Source: Wikipedia, "Empire Earth," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

The Gold Edition packaged the original game and The Art of Conquest expansion together. (Still using the original disks, as opposed to a combined disk.)

99527.name: Towers of Darkness
99527.description:
User Summary

A three-in-one compilation Hexen/Heretic compliation released on CD-ROM, subtitled "Heretic, Hexen & Beyond". It came out around the same time as Hexen II.

The disk mentions 'Published by Id Software, Inc.", and also has a logo for "GT Interactive Software, Value Products Division".

99528.name: Super Ninja Boy
99528.description:
Super Ninja Boy (Super Chinese World in Japan) is an action role-playing game released for the Super NES. It features random encounters with side-scrolling battles, although some boss battles are fought with a traditional menu-based system. There are also a few platforming sections.
In single player mode, the main character is Jack. The game can be switched between single player and multiplayer at will, with the second player controlling Ryu. Jack and Ryu share statistics, so one character never overpowers the other.
Super Ninja Boy features a password system to record progress.
It is a sequel to Culture Brain's previous title, Little Ninja Brothers for the NES.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Ninja Boy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99529.name: Color Quest
99529.description:
Color Quest is a "magical strategy game for 2-3 players. Players travel the board using color, acquiring gold, gems and magical abilities." This is "a computer-assisted board game, where room contents are preselected by computer, and hints progressively revealed to players... Once a player has 25,000 gold pieces, and at least 1 Power Square, they may attempt to win." Other players may attempt to thwart the victory attempt and win themselves.

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

99530.name: Fantasy Franchise
99530.description:
Fantasy Franchise is "a real estate game where players purchase franchises, lease space in central Florida malls, and eventually purchase the malls themselves!" The malls feature "everything from movie theatres to Mall Security. Nearly all the names are tongue in cheek." The names of the stores and movie posters feature puns and parodies of popular brands such as "Taxi Driver II: My Fare, Lady!" and "While You Were Sleeping... the Movie Ended"

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

99531.name: Castles & Caverns
99531.description:
Castles & Caverns is a fantasy game in which players try to "build the most beautiful castle", but are faced with numerous challenges. The game features "magic and swordplay combined with bidding and strategy, and of course, lots of treasure!" The game board is marked with four cavern areas, "Spire Falls", "Gold Ridge", "Ice Flow", and "Enchanted."

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

99532.name: Alchemy
99532.description:
Alchemy is an "exploration and resource management game for 2-3 players." Players use alchemy ..... Combine different color powders to gain special abilities, or find the best trading routes to maximize your profit. Players score victory points on gold, unused workers, and magic spells (the amount of victory points is somewhat variable since alchemy can be applied to the items to adjust the point values).

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

99533.name: Heroes of the Solar System
99533.description:
Heroes of the Solar System is "an educational science game for 2-4 players who provide supplies to mankind's colonies throughout the solar system. The colonists on each planet need different things to survive, and award "Rescue Points" to the player who offers them the most of what they need." The game is designed for team play.

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

99534.name: Clockworks
99534.description: Clockworks is a betting game based on Poker. There is a card dealt into the middle of the table which is shared among all players' hands. When a player is dealt a card of the same suit it dealt, he or she can pay to replace the card in the center of the table. Subsequent players can buy the replaced card for their own hand in lieu of being dealt a card. The common card that will actually be used for all hands isn't actually known until the end of the hand. The winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

99535.name: Revolver
99535.description: Revolver is a betting game based on Poker. Players are each dealt two face down cards and then select face up cards from two rows in the table to build their hands. Players bet and then following this, another two rows are dealt which players select cards from. Players bet and the receive one more card dealt face down. The winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

99536.name: Auction Poker
99536.description: Auction Poker is a card game based loosely on Poker. Eight cards are dealt face up and players use special bidding cards (1-5 per player) to win the cards to build their hands. Directional cards (1-3, "across" and "down") indicate the position of the cards being bid on that round. Players reveal their bids and the lowest bidder gets first selection of three identified cards or one face down card from the deck. After all players have built their hands, the winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

99537.name: Louis XVI
99537.description: Louis XVI is a tafl style game in which players must try to help King Louis XVI escape from an angry mob. The king player receives one king piece and an army of 18. The mob player gets 26 pieces. Play is set on a star shape board. Captures are done by jumping adjacent enemy pieces and are compulsory. The mob wins if the king is captured and the king player wins by getting the king piece to any of the points of the star.

videogame.74178: Heroes of Might and Magic V

99539.name: Heroes of Might and Magic V: Gold Edition

videogamecompilation.74178: Heroes of Might and Magic V

99539.description:
From the back of the box

EXPERIENCE THE ENTIRE HEROES OF MIGHT AND MAGIC V SAGA
from the beginning to the end, including the new Tribes Of The East stand-alone expansion, which brilliantly concludes this epic adventure!

Heroes of Might and Magic V
Dive into a "deep fantasy" universe with stunning next-generation 3D visuals, groundbreaking strategic combat, innovative multiplayer features and addictive RPG elements.

Hammers of Fate
Take part in a thrilling adventure with the Hammers of Fate expansion. Discover uncharted territories, lead the new Dwarves and renegade Haven factions to victory, and experience new ways of playing Heroes of Might & Magic V

Tribes of the East
For the first time, play as the savage Orc faction and experience the dramatic conclusion of the usurper Biara's reign. Expand your arsenal and gameplay witha new campaign, new spells, new artefacts and innovative features such as the combo-based Artefact Sets as well as the unique Blood Rage racial ability.

Bonus DVD
Heroes V, Hammers of Fate and Tribes of the East trailers - Storyline Trailer - Developer Diaries - HOMM V Universe album - Exclusive Monster Test videos - Fan made Heroes Game Encyclopedia - And more

User Summary
Besides everything listed above, HOMM-V is patched to version 1.50.

Supported screen resolutions: from 640x480 up to 1680x1050

99540.name: Bohnanza
99540.description:
To Bean or not to Bean for iPhone and iPad

Play Bohnanza anytime and anywhere!

Play Bohnanza, the cult card game all about trading beans on your iPhone, iPod touch or iPad! Grow your beans and harvest them at the right time and earn yourself valuable Bean Dollars.

Get fresh! The card game Bohnanza allows you to trade different types of beans on the global bean market, grow them in your fields and selling your harvest at a profit. Trading is particularly important, because what else could you do with your Stink Bean when you can only grow Green Beans or Chili Beans. So, get rid of it! You can even give it away, and sometimes this may win you the game.

Bohnanza is a fun and easy card game. Negotiating skillfully and keeping a watchful eye on your opponents' bean fields help you maximize your profits.

Source: The Developer Website.

99541.name: Vampire Rush: The Adventures of Captain Greg
99541.description:
Nobody likes vampires, everybody likes heroes! Slay the evil hordes in this awesome tower defense game!

You are Captain Greg, the glorious hero adventurer, on a mission to defend the Gates that lead from the Vampire Underworld to the world of the living.

Source: The Publisher Website.

99542.name: Solipskier

videogamehonor.32222: 2011 IGF Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

99542.description:
Draw snow under Solipskier to gain speed, do tricks and hit bonus gates. Avoid the jump chasms and red gates and try to get the highest score you can! Share scores with your friends to see who's the best.

Source: The Developer Website.

99543.name: Illusia
99543.description:
The makers of ZENONIA have extended to a new side scrolling casual action RPG containing all the core elements of traditional role playing games presented in visually appealing anime style graphics.

Explore through quests, refine your gear, and battle your way to unravel the secrets behind the mysterious tower of ILLUSIA that nobody has entered before!

Annihilate evil and preserve good, on your adventure of restoring peace to the land of Aztaran...

Source: The Developer Website.

99544.name: Party Gras
99544.description:
Party Gras, billed as "Bourbon Street in a box", is a game of drinking, groping and flashing. Players are given strings of beads, which they can lose to, or acquire from, other players by way of instructions on the spinner or spaces on the board.

In true Mardi Gras fashion, bead exchanges are most often accomplished by flashing other players, or having other players flash you. The rules state that this involves baring one's chest, but also suggest that guys may be "a bit more creative".

The base mechanic is "spin and move" as the player's pieces (shot glasses) move along a winding track. Players must follow the directions on the spinner and board. The person holding the most strings of beads when any player crosses the finish line is the official winner.

99545.name: Polyhedron (Issue 131 - Vol. 18, No. 4)
99545.description:
Cover art: FIGHT! Corey Macourek does a stylish Frank Miller homage involving two beefy types mixing it up old style.

This issue's theme was Marvel Superheroes, including the credits which were listed as 'The Baxter Building', 'Sue Storm', 'Mr. Fantastic', 'Willie Lumpkin', 'The Yancy Street Gang', and 'H.E.R.B.I.E.' instead of the normal titles (Publisher, Editor, etc.).

99546.name: Polyhedron (Issue 132 - Vol. 18, No. 5)

rpgissuearticle.53750: All I Really Need to Know i Learned from the AD&D game

99546.description:
Cover art: Dennis Detwiler shows us the danger of stealing rings from giants. Especially eerie, pupilless giants.

This issue's theme was Thieves, even down to the credits which were listed as 'The Thieves' Guild', 'Master Thief', 'Sharper', 'Filchers', 'Cutpurses', and 'Rogue (Apprentice)' instead of the normal titles (Publisher, Editor, etc.).
Featured articles:

Law in Campaigns
Audition - an AD&D adventure for thieves, or thief wanna-bes
Game of Masks - a preview of the City of Ravens Bluff book
Responses to our query: Everything I Need to Know I Learned from the AD&D Game




It also included an order form for RPGA merchandise on the inside back mailing cover, and a list of Adventurer's Guild Retailers on the outside back mailing cover.

99547.name: Polyhedron (Issue 136 - Vol. 19, No. 3)
99547.description:
Cover art: Hannibal King drew her, you figure out who she is. Freckles and all. A contest to write up the cover figure as an NPC for the Living City campaign.

This was an All LIVING CITY issue - Special "Collector's Item."

Featured articles:

LIVING CITY Sites to see on the Web
City Stories - The Temple of Selune
Rockroost - A LIVING CITY Business
Swash That Buckle - How to make Combat more Heroic
Winter Fantasy 2000 Information




There was also a reader survey on p. 32, ads for Origins and GEN CON on the inside front and back mailing cover, and an Adventurer's Guild Retailers listing on the outside back mailing cover.

99548.name: Polyhedron (Issue 137 - Vol. 19, No. 4)

rpgissuearticle.53926: Airs Above the Ground: A Manual of Dexterity for Warhorses

99548.description:
Cover art: Hannibal King, ace troll artist, and all around nice guy. True story.

The theme of this issue was "Into the Unknown", with the credits page featuring titles like "Scout Ranger Service", "Native Guide", "Lantern Bearer", "Wilderness Tour Promoters", "Sherpas", and "Pack Horse" instead of the usual Publisher, Editor, etc. Also the editors of this issue seemed to have some fascination with monkeys...

Featured articles:

Uncovering Government Agenies on the Web
City Stories - The Temple of Mystra
Decathlon Sci-Fi Winners
Planescape and AD&D Adventures
The Use and Abuse of Warhorses in AD&D




There was also a Readers Survey on page 32, an ad for the Winter Fantasy 2000/RPGA Summit on the inside front mailing cover, and the Adventurer's Guild Retailers list on the outside back mailing cover.

99549.name: Polyhedron (Issue 139 - Vol. 19, No. 6)
99549.description:
Cover art: Hannibal King.

This issue's theme was Tournaments, with articles on several new rules and changes in the RPGA Network for the new millenium.

Featured articles:

The RPGA's "New Deal" - Better than Roosevelt's!
2000 Clubs Decathlon
LIVING VERGE up the wazoo!




It also featured an ad for the Winter Fantasy Show 2000/RPGA Summit on the inside front mailing cover, a Reader Survey on page 32, and a list of Adventurer's Guild Retailers on the outside back mailing cover.

99552.name: Dicey Wheels
99552.description:
According to the box, this game was designed to help players become safer drivers.

Players start with $3,260 and make a $250 down payment on their "Klunka" (car) to start the game. On each turn, the player rolls the dice to travel along the highway and draws a card, following its instructions. Cards may instruct the player to go to various points on the board, recite a tongue twister, pay a fine, go to jail, earn money or answer a driver test question.

First player to get 10 points on driver test questions, make four payments on their Klunka, and have $5,000 wins the game.

99553.name: The Shade of Zombie
99553.description:
The Shade of Zombie is a merger between game of strategy and game of letters where the player must manage eliminate the Zombies against which he is to be able to count. A slightly conventional mechanics drags the player to a combat against enormous hordes Zombies.

The game this one thought to receive added since they can be new cards with new values and attributes beside introducing concrete areas of game since it can be boards and scenery.

It uses several systems of game of exclusive creation since it is CdB's Runic System and the System sequence to establish dynamic not cyclical shifts.

The aim of the players is to eliminate Zombies, nevertheless the game this one very modified since all the systems for which it operates have been designed separately, we will see that systems have used and his application in game.

The system of shifts "System Sequence" is a system of shifts for level of priority, this is established by the value of the Zombies against which we fight.

Initially of the game every player receives 2 Zombies's cards establishing by means of the sum of his values a total quantity that will be his priority of game.

Procedure: maximum of 3 Zombies for player, increase of priority for the not irresolute Zombies and decrease for the irresolute Zombies.

This gives like proved a different value between players and the order of the shifts decides, the system repeats itself during the whole item and this gives like proved a different order from shifts constant.

The player once in his shift must resort to eliminating Zombies, for this it was using a special system of so called combat " SEDD Runic " formed by 3 cards that give like proved combinations two-color on having placed in pyramidal formation.

Every Zombie that the player possesses in front of, includes 4 cards that in his set they form combinations Two-color, similar to the combinations obtained for BE Runic, using BE and in similarity of combinations the player ire withdrawing segments of the Zombies up to managing to eliminate them.

There are 3 types of Zombies, the positives " increase priority " negatives " diminish priority " and puntuables " they allow on having played to count for the final inventory ".

Once it is achieved to count, the player must study where to count since we speak about the system Faction.

The system Faction is a system of punctuations for faction, this one based on a board divided by 2 different decrees, the first board that is completed is used for the final inventory. Every section can include a maximum of 10 points, nevertheless the players only possess a maximum of 6 cards to include in the board, thus the system of punctuation is established like strategically.

The system of shifts, the system of combat and the system of punctuation are 3 bases on which Zombie operates on The Shade of, his architecture has as aim be strategic for the player since on having established a correct strategy, the shifts can be extended, we can create alliances between players and can create a sequential strategy of shifts that give us mas opportunities against another player for the simple fact of creating an order of shifts based on the basic calculation of increase and level decrease of priority.

All that achieves by means of 25 cards that there includes the game that they are the technical base of all his development, whereas the rest of components alone are cards to mark condition and others both with the player and with the Zombies.

It paginates of exhibition: http://cdb.creatuforo.com/the-shade-of-zombies-tema68.html

99554.name: J: The Misere Connection Game
99554.description:
J: The Misere Connection Game is in the family of connection games that include Hex and Gonnect. It is unique in that players can win if they force their opponent to form a connection between two areas on the board, and takes place on an 8x4 board.

The origins of this game date back to a failed attempt to come up with a connection game for Stonehenge, which had an outer track that is very long but very tight. The shift to a set 8x4 board caused the game to be viewed differently than on the circular board of Stonehenge.

Another unique aspect to J is that players can LOSE the game if they form a certain type of connection, which would be a misere condition in a connection game. This is also a a unique feature. I had been pondering how to do one and J provides the opportunity to do this.

The game also features several other uncommon features, besides the small board and misere game ending condition, like piece recycling, and also entire lines of pieces being pushed.

99555.description:
¡Combate en una épica batalla espacial!
Las cinco razas más poderosas de la galaxia se enfrentan en un estratégico combate por el control de la galaxia Zyrcan... ¿serás lo suficientemente hábil con tus naves?

Contenido del juego:
-1 Tablero
- 60 fichas de nave (12 por jugador)

Objetivo:
Los jugadores ponen todas sus naves en la galaxia Zyrcan y luego entablan una encarnizada batalla por su control. El jugador que más naves consiga tener al final de la batalla será el ganador.


Fight in an epic space battle!
The five most powerful races in the galaxy face off in a strategic battle for control of the galaxy Zyrcan ... Will you be skillful enough with your ships?

Game content:
- 1 Boardgame
- 60 ship Tokens (12 each player)

Goal:
The players put all their ships in the Zyrcan galaxy and then engage in a fierce battle for control. The player gets to have more ships at the end of the battle will be the winner.
99555.name: Zyrcan

99556.name: Cross Town Coordinates
99556.description:
Go on a cross-town scavenger hunt to practice geometry and graphing! Coordinate cards direct players to move to different community places. Flip cards over to see if you moved correctly. Game board features positive coordinates on one side, and both positive and negative coordinates on the reverse for more advanced play.
Add the fun of a scavenger hunt to geometry lessons! Teaches the Cartesian plane in a real-world context. Board features positive coordinates on one side, and both positive and negative coordinates on the reverse for more advanced play.
- Draw an x-y coordinate card
- Use the game board coordinates to move your pawn to the location on your card
- Look at the community building picture on the back of your card to see if you moved correctly; if so, mark the location off your checklist
- Finish your checklist first to win!
-Positive and Negative Cartesian Coordinates

Contents:

150 Coordinate Cards
4 Game Pawns
Scavenger-hunt Checklist
Double-sided Game Board

99557.name: GEOdice
99557.description:
The goal is to name countries and capitals that start with the letters on the five Letter Dice, and that are within the continents on the two Continent Dice. With colorful dice and a two-sided Game Board that doubles as a world map, GeoDice is a beguiling introduction to world geography! A fun way to learn geography! Roll into world knowledge with GeoDice, a game that makes geography fun!

Contents:

Game Board world Map,
5 Letter Dice,
2 Continent Dice,
Dice Shaker,
Sand Timer,
Scorecard,
Rules
Country/Capital List

99558.name: Snap Shots Across America
99558.description: Need a Vacation? Snapshots Across America, The Vacation Fantasy Game you can play at home. Travel across a game board map of the U.S.A. by car, train, boat or plane to see top tourist attractions from all 50 states. But watch out for bad weather! A hurricane, blizzard, tornado or other bad weather could spoil your vacation. Win by being the first to visit 7 different tourist attractions that are pictured on the cards. A fun way to learn U.S. Geography and discover great vacation destinations. Average game plays 15-20 minutes. Ages: 8 and Up, 2-6 Players

99559.name: Brick: Make the Shape
99559.description: A dexterity / party game, in which player compete to form shapes with Lego bricks, based on the non-verbal information of the other players in their teams. Contains different cards with shapes worth a variable amount of points.

99560.name: Fluke HD
99560.description:
From the developers website

Rediscover the joy of board games on the iPad with Fluke HD. Download this visually vibrant and action filled game today to play with your friends, family, or loved ones. Fluke HD represents a digital twist on the board game genre with gameplay in the vein of classics such as Snakes & Ladders, Sorry! and Ludo.

Fluke HD is a virtual board game that requires opponents to employ both strategic play and a healthy dose of luck. Players are each given four colored tokens which they must navigate across any one of the game’s many uniquely themed boards in order to win.
A victory can only be achieved if a player is able to get all four of their game pieces across the finish line. Though seemingly straight forward, a variety of different interactive obstacles and surprises await players on each of the game’s four board options and no two boards are alike. Users can either play against live opponents or online via Apple’s Game Center.

Besides providing customers with engaging and exiting gameplay, another main focus of Fluke HD is to offer users an iPad based board game that utilizes this mobile media to its full potential. The game synthesizes dynamic graphics with smooth gameplay to give players a multiplayer experience that is truly worthy not only of their time but of repeated plays as well.

Because of its painstaking attention to game graphics, playing dynamics, and overall quality, Fluke HD is able to handedly surpass even the most premium board game titles currently floating around on the Apple App Store.

Go ahead, grab a friend and get in on the action with Fluke HD!

♦ APP FEATURES:
✔ Live multi-player capability
✔ Apple Game Center integration
✔ Fluke HD is OpenFeint enabled
✔ 4 uniquely themed board layouts
✔ AI support with 3 difficulty levels
✔ Interactive online leaderboards via OpenFeint integration
✔ Un-lockable game achievements
✔ Original game music and in-game sound effects

99561.name: Was klotzt du?
99561.description:
In Was klotzt du?, the players try to explain a concept using a set of wooden blocks.

The game is played in timed rounds. In each round, one player is the explainer, while the other players try to guess the concept. The explainer receives a set of 24 blocks (consisting of 11 brown blocks and 13 blocks of other colours). He is also given a card which tells him the concept that he has to explain using the blocks. He may not talk or make sounds, though he may move the blocks. He can also give a hint by placing one of his non-brown blocks in one of the circles on the board that show different categories.

If one of the other players successfully guesses the concept, he gets the card and the block used to give a hint (if any). Then, all non-brown blocks are placed aside, and the explainer receives a new card, and continues to explain the new concept with the remaining blocks. This continues until the time runs out, after which the results are scored. The explainer receives points for each concept he has explained, and each other player receives points for each concept he has guessed. Each concept is worth 1 to 4 points, depending on the amount of non-brown blocks that have been set aside. The more blocks that have been used during the round, the higher the value of the concepts.

Now, a new round begins, and the next player becomes the explainer. The game ends after each player has been the explainer thrice; the player who has gathered the most points wins.

99562.name: 2, 3, 4 Play Air Hockey
99562.description:
Hit the ice with 2-3-4 Play Air Hockey! This multi-player arcade
style game captures all the action of real air hockey - right on your tabletop! Listen as real air flows through its playing surface, gliding the puck on a cushion of speed! Using the included custom dividers, you can instantly convert the playing surface for 2, 3, or 4-player gaming! Push button flippers and built-in arcade sound effects help keep the action fast and fun.

Components:

1 Plastic game board (with 4 scorekeepers)
3 Playing field dividers
1 Angled divider
2 Straight dividers
12 Plastic pucks

99563.name: Malice
99563.description:
From the back of the box:

In a war between two unlikely forces, a strange girl dies, only to escape the long queues of dead in the afterlife and return to fix the fractures worlds it seems she might have created. On her return, she reboot the orrery, the machine that turns the universe, and travel through the elemental gates.

All time-lines lead to a final blistering conflict with a super-fueled, lava drooling, nuclear fire god, hell bent on consuming the planet... Surreal, stunning and unique, Malice is a cataclysmically dark and comic tale.


Guide Malive through 22 levels of elemental chaos



Us an array of spectacular magic skills and apocalyptic weaponry, like the clockwork hammer, the mace of clubs and the quantum tuning fork.



Help Malice evolve through 4 different incarnations to become the goddess destined to defeat a god gone mad.



Fantastic graphics, fluid gameplay, compelling storyline, and funny characterisation.

99564.name: Fishing Fantasy: Buzzrod
99564.description:
From the back of the box:

Experience an incredible fishing adventure...

...with Possum, discover species of fantastic fish, but that's not all; some secret texts will lead you to an ancient culture that worships fish as the messengers of god...

The fish have taken the bait and your quest is just beginning.

99565.name: Blade Dancer: Lineage of Light
99565.description:
From the back of the box:

Brandish your blade and dance of the edge of destiny!

A mysterious girl with no memory of her past. A knight in black armour appears from nowhere on the legendary island of Foo where the Prismatic Moon shines. The legend of "Blade Dancer" will be revived.

Full 3D Adventure Field: Explore towns, fields and dungeons, all in a large-scale, fully 3D environment.

In Depth Item Crafting: Appraise an item you obtain to and discover its recipe to create new items.

Exciting Real Time Battles: A completely real-time battle system. Experience a new type of battle in a fight to charge your Lunar Gauge and execute special abilities.

Find Your Ultimate Weapons!!: 2-4 player co-op play with Wireless (WLAN) function.

99567.name: Capsized

videogamehonor.33107: 2012 CVA Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee

99567.description:
Capsized is a fast paced 2d platformer developed by Alientrap Games, focused on intense action and exploration.

As a intrepid space traveler, your ship has crash landed on a mysterious alien planet. You must navigate through the perilous environment and fight off blood-thirsty creatures to save your crewmates and escape with your lives!

Source: The Game Website.

99568.name: BEEP
99568.description:
BEEP is a 2D side-scrolling platformer with physics-based gameplay. You control a small robot equipped with an anti-gravity device, a jet-pack and a gun. Drive, jump, fly, swim and shoot your way through 24 levels scattered across 6 unique environments.

Source: The Game Website.

99569.name: Kawumm!
99569.description:
From the developer web site:
"Stop or continue? In Kawumm! each player plays at own risk. After every round the player must decide if he buy three new ingredients or if he wishes to secure all the ingredients already collected. But if none of the drawn card matches his collection: Then it makes Kawumm! and all ingredients are lost.
- Card game for real gamers
- Fast to learn

99570.name: Lamentations of the Flame Princess (Grindhouse Edition)

rpgissuearticle.95699: New Character Creation and Advancement Techniques

99570.description:
Beyond the borders of civilization, beyond the influence of manipulating politicians, greedy merchants, iron-handed clergy, and the broken masses that toil for their benefit, the ruins of ancient civilizations call to those bold enough, and desperate enough, to escape the oppression of mundane life. Treasure and glory await those courageous enough to wrest it from the darkness. But the danger is great, for lurking in the forgotten shadows are forces far more corrupt than even civilization. The price for freedom might be paid in souls.

LotFP: Weird Fantasy Role-Playing presents a sinister and horrific twist on traditional fantasy gaming and provides you with all the tools needed to create and run a long-lasting campaign tailored to your specific vision. Simple enough for a beginner – with material intended for those that have never before played a role-playing game – yet meaty enough for the veteran, this is a complete game in one box.

The Grindhouse Edition includes never-before-seen spells, magic items, and introductory adventure, as well as a revised layout and over 100 new pieces of fantastic art that will transport you into the nightmare world of LotFP: Weird Fantasy Role-Playing!

(Warning: Explicit Imagery! Recommended for ages 18+)

Included in this box:

• Tutorial Book (96 pages) Introducing the Basics of Role-Playing
• Rules and Magic Book (168 pages) A comprehensive reference for playing the game
• Referee Book (96 pages) Tools for campaigns and adventure
• 7-piece Dice Set
• Character Sheets

Artwork by:  Rowena Aitken , Aeron Alfrey,  Tomas Arfert,  Dan Berger , Johnathan Bingham , Nicole Cardiff,  Christina Casperson , Ernie Chan , Dean Clayton,  Ramsey Dow , Laura Jalo , Daniel Lapham , Vincent Locke , Eric Lofgren , Rich Longmore , Peter Mullen , Russ Nicholson , Jason Rainville , Cynthia Sheppard,  Amos Orion Sterns , Filip Stojak

Description from company website.

99571.name: Polyhedron (Issue 138 - Vol. 19, No. 5)

rpgissuearticle.53940: City Stories; Steel Dungeons and Iron Dragons

99571.description:
Cover art: A typical New York subway scene. Circa 1890, of course. By the illustrious, and spooky, Hannibal King.

This issue featured Dilemma's Tusks - an AD&D adventure for 6 PCs of levels 3-6, and a preview of LIVING GREYHAWK.

99572.name: Polyhedron (Issue 140 - Vol. 20, No. 1)

rpgissuearticle.54231: Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guid to the FORGOTTEN REALMS

99572.description:
Cover art: Hannibal King.

This issue's theme was "the Underdark."

Featured articles:

If it's under dark, it's under here! City of Ooze Spectacular
Who's What in Ravens Deep
Living City Judging Guidelines - never suffer a cheater!
Wanna write for Poly? Details Inside!




It also featured an order form for RPGA merchandise on the inside front mailing cover, a Reader Survey on page 32, and a list of Adventurer's Guild Retailers on the outside back mailing cover.

184564.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Days of Villainy

boardgameintegration.193024: Lock 'n Load Tactical World War II Era Core Rules

99573.description:
Heroes of the Pacific brings the award-winning Lock ’n Load Tactical game system to the Pacific theater with a vengeance. Heroes of the Pacific details America’s brawl with Japan during World War 2, and includes twelve frantic firefights from America’s audacious island-hopping campaign. You will lead desperate Marines struggling ashore on Tarawa, face a counterattack of HA GO tanks at the Peleliu airfield, fight for Kitano Point on Iwo Jima, and more.

It isn’t, however, all about the Marines; Heroes of the Pacific comes chock full of the U.S. Army’s finest, as well as the Imperial Japanese Army, all drawn with the painstaking detail our fans have come to expect.

It’s squad-level combat at its most exciting; it’s Lock ’n Load Tactical.
99573.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific

99574.name: Polyhedron (Issue 141 - Vol. 20, No. 2)
99574.description:
Cover art by Hannibal King.

The theme for this issue was thieves: A special issue for our most larcenous readers...

It included a 2000 GEN CON Game Fair Event Grid on the inside front mailing cover, a Reader Survey on page 32, an Origins Event Grid on the inside back mailing cover, and an "Adventurer's Guild Retailers list on the outside back mailing cover.

99575.name: Polyhedron (Issue 142 - Vol. 20, No. 3)
99575.description:
Cover art by Hannibal King.

This issue's theme was Horror & Conspiracies.

Featured articles:

Fear Theatre: Le Grand Guignol
Men of the Basilisk
Using the Undead




It also featured a Reader Survey on page 32, a list of available back issues of Polyhedron on the inside front and back mailing cover, and the Adventurer's Guild Retailers list on the outside back mailing cover.

This was the first issue of Polyhedron which listed the publisher as Wizards of the Coast instead of TSR.

99576.name: Polyhedron (Issue 143 - Vol. 20, No. 4)

rpgissuearticle.54764: Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guide to the FORGOTTEN REALMS

99576.description:
Cover art by Hannibal King.

The theme of this issue was "the Wilderness'

Featured article:

Wilderness Encounter Ideas
Alternity GAMMA WORLD adventure - Fire Island




On the credits page, this issue was mislabeled as "June 2000".

99577.name: Flipper Foot
99577.description: A tabletop soccer game in which you use two flippers to shoot the ball into your opponent’s goal.

99578.name: Champion
99578.description: Object is to collect the most points by throwing the sandbags into the point slots. Player or team with the most points is the winner.

99580.name: Real World Golf
99580.description:
User Summary

Golf game designed to be played with the GameTrak motion capture system. Features all the standard modes of play such as career, championship and four-player tornament over 5 different courses.

99581.name: Dice Cricket
99581.description:
Dice cricket is a dexterity and dice cricket game. There are no dates on the box or directions, but the general style suggests that it may be from the 1930s or 1940s. The directions (nothing as common as rules in this game) leave it to the players to decide how to organise the match - innings, numbers of players and so on.

Players put the pair of stumps about 5 to 6 feet apart ("the average length of an ordinary dining table" as the directions helpfully tell us). Dice are used as balls in the game. The bowler gently pitches a die (with faces 1, 2, 4, 6, out and NR (for no runs) to the batsman, preferably without the die touching the table. The batsman tries to hit it. If he misses and the stumps are hit, the batsman is out bowled. If he hits the die and it is caught by the bowler, the player is out caught. Otherwise, if he hits it, the result of the shot is shown by the top face of the die.

99582.name: Realms of Crawling Chaos
99582.description:
From back cover:

In R'lyeh, Cthulhu Stirs...


Evil cultists consummate their union with Shub-Niggurath in dark woods no other mortals dare go. Alien terrors lurk in the underworld; their vast riches wait, or their incomprehensible powers could leave you broken, dead, or worse. Adventure in underworlds filled with horrible entities, or the ruins of alien beings that enslaved the ape-like ancestors of mankind. Seek hidden secrets from the arctic wastes to dark, briny seas. But as you approach the ocean, what are those strange longings you feel?


Realms of Crawling Chaos is a Lovecraftian Dark Fantasy campaign supplement for Labyrinth Lord and the Advanced Edition Companion.

In this book you will find:


New player races, including white apes, white ape hybrids, sea blood, and subhumans.
New spells
New monsters
New artifacts and a system for designing unique artifacts
Rules for psionics, compatible with Mutant Future

99583.name: Jogo das Comemorações Coca-Cola
99583.description:
This is a small promotion game in Brazil the works just like Top Trumps, composed of 32 cards.
Every player has a set of cards representing different ways to celebrate a Football Goal with points for creativity, beauty, joy, difficulty and irreverence. Every player see the top card of his deck and the star player choose a characteristic of his own card.
The player with most points in the characteristic wins and bring the looser's cards to his deck.
There is a trump ("Drink a Coke") that beats every card, except the card number 8, 16, 24 and 32.
When a player manage to take all 32 cards, he wins the game

99584.name: Ikaros HD
99584.description:
Escape the Isle of Crete on wings made of wax. Control IKAROS (better known today as Icarus) to run and fly your way to safety while collecting treasures.

CONTROLS

The goal is to run and fly as far as you can without falling in the water.
Touch anywhere to flap your wings.
Hold your finger down to fly a little higher.
You may flap 3 times before landing.




ADVANCED

Gather coins and gems to raise your Flight Meter.
Fill the Flight Meter to earn a brief Speed Boost.
During a Speed Boost, you may flap as much as you like.




SPECIAL FEATURES

Full Game Center support
Amazing 2D character animation using brand new technology never seen in a game before
Universal App: plays on iPhone and iPad
Facebook integration: post your scores from in-game
10 challenging achievements
Gorgeous full-screen background transitions from night to day as you play
Twitter support: tweet your hi-scores without leaving the game
Online leaderboard, compete with the whole world
Dynamic terrain: never play the same game twice!




Source: The Game Website.

99585.name: Gravity Hook
99585.description:
Gravity Hook is a flash game created by Adam Atomic and Danny Baranowsky way back in August 2008, and marks their first collaboration. It was based on a typing-tutor prototype game called Gravity Key, created by Arne Niklas Jansson. Arne gave his permission for Adam to develop a mouse-based version that scrolled onward and upward forever. The original Gravity Hook was created in 5 days on a very early version of what is now the flixel framework.

Gravity Hook received a lot of praise but also a lot of well-deserved complaints about the difficulty of play. Gravity Hook HD is a chance for Adam and Danny to revisit their first project with an extra year of experience and see if they have anything worthwhile to add. New graphics, new sound, new controls, and new gameplay make HD an entirely new game. For those hardcore fans of the old version, we've also included a special treat! But you'll need to climb at least 500m to find it...

Source: The Game Website.

99586.name: 3-Card Brigade Poker
99586.description:
User Summary

3-Card Brigade Poker is expressly based on Reiner Knizia's Schotten-Totten. One player can play against the AI in a "campaign" of matches. There is no multiplayer.

99587.name: The Wizard and the Princess
99587.description:
User Summary

Hi-res graphical adventure game, the spiritual and literal predecessor of King's Quest. This was the first game of its kind (graphics plus text) to have color graphics.

The object is to find and return Princess Priscilla, who was kidnapped and bewitched by a wicked wizard. Designed by Roberta and Kenn Williams, the story is based on stories read in Roberta's youth.

99588.name: NBA 07: Featuring the Life Vol. 2
99588.description:
From the back of the case

Experience the NBA's Next Great Rivalry.


Live the life of an NBA player while experiencing it all on and off the court.



Volume 2 highlights the rivalry between The Kid and Big W as both playable characters battle for MVP honors and a Championship.



In addition to The Life Volume 2, NBA '07 offers a true simulation featuring all the NBA teams, players and arenas.



New Power Boarding Mechanism lets you crash the boards with authority and pull down the rebound.



New Open Shot Indicator clearly illustrates how open your shooter is based on the defensive pressure.



More than a dozen mini-games including Own The Court, Free Throw, Two-On-Two and other playground classics.

99589.name: iDixit
99589.description:
Our first adaptation, Dixit, is a Jean-Louis Roubira game, published by Libellud and internationally multi-awarded. Dixit is a game for 3 to 6 players. The principle being to confront your own way of thinking with the other players' by giving them a clue, neither too precise nor too vague.

Each player has 6 cards in his deck. The first player (the storyteller) selects one and gives a clue reflecting his perception of the picture. Each other players chooses a card they think matches best the given clue, then all cards are revealed. The goal of the game is to find which card had been chosent by the storyteller, without falling in the traps set by the others.

Several gaming modes are offered, allowing the widest amount of freedom. Dixit is a multiplayer game, and can be played sitting round a table, either remotely. A solo tutorial mode help discovering the game's principles and interface.

Source: The Developer Website.

99590.name: Fortress Craft: Chapter 1 – Creation
99590.description:
Fortress Craft is an independently developed and produced game about construction, survival and destruction.

Explore vast domains and mould them in your image. Construct your own world from the materials around and defend it against would be attackers.

Source: The Game Website.

99592.name: Death of an Intergalactic Salesman
99592.description:
Theme: Willy Slowman was probably the best intergalactic merchant ever to tackle the business. He started out with a hundred credits to his name and the keys to a small cargo hauler. Over the years he forged intergalactic trade routes, stared down pirates and amassed a small fortune.

When Willy died he left behind a sizeable fortune and a single stipulation in his will, that one of his relatives would prove to be the rightful heir to his shipping empire by following in his footsteps. Relatives started pouring out of the woodwork trying for a chance to win Willy's fortune. You know nothing about trade routes, or pirates, or the galaxy at large... but this is a chance of a lifetime. As one of Willy's recognized relatives (fourth cousin of a nephew, twice removed) the lawyers for the Slowman estate are going to provide you with 100 credits and a small cargo hauler, if you can be the first to amass 1000 credits you will prove yourself to be the rightful heir.

Gameplay: In this game the players race around the board to pick-up and deliver chits to amass their fortunes. The board is modular in order to increase replayability, and the chits are not sorted to decrease the set-up time (chits only have to be added/removed when changing the starting worlds - not the board layout). Chits include Events which have a timed effect, Goods, Passengers, Enemies which can harass the players or be hunted for bounty, Mined Goods and Ship Upgrades (increase your combat effectiveness or speed). This allows for a variety of gameplay strategies. The rules have been streamlined and every effort has been made to make it as streamlined and simple as possible without losing any of the flavor or depth.

But in the end the game is all about making money, and the first player to 1000 credits is the winner.

99593.name: Entombed
99593.description:
Game Manual

You and your team of archeologists have fallen into the "catacombs of the zombies." There's no time to look around; these guys are after you, and they mean business! Your only salvation is that you have discovered the secret to the "make-break." Grab them, and you can break through walls when you get stuck, or create a wall behind you -- if you are being chased.

The longer you survive, the faster you have to move.

Explore alone, or two archeologists can work together or compete in a frenzied trek through the catacombs.

99594.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3

videogamehonor.31918: 2011 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee

99594.description:
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (abbreviated as Call of Duty: MW3) is an upcoming first-person shooter video game currently in co-development by Infinity Ward and Sledgehammer Games, with Raven Software assisting multiplayer development. It will be the third installment in the Modern Warfare series, and the eighth Call of Duty installment in total.
The game will immediately follow the events of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, where Russia continues its invasion of the United States of America, and has also expanded its offensive to Europe, including England, France and Germany. It has also been reported that the game's finale will be set in the city of Dubai.

Source: Wikipedia, "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99595.name: Scenariebogen: 9 fremragende danske rollespilsscenarier 2006-2010
99595.description:
From the back of the book:
Velkommen til dansk rollespil anno 2011.

Scenariebogen er en hyldest til bredden og dybden i dansk rollespil.

Bogen du lige nu har mellem hænderne indeholder ni rollespilsscenarier. der på hver sin måde er fremragende. Indholdet spænder bredt, fra det glade action-eventyr til det voksne og voldsomme. Her er noget for de fleste, og noget for de få. Der er noget der er let at gå til og noget der vil være svært at gå fra. Her er både lette oplevelser, og oplevelser der sætter dybe spor og giver stof til eftertanke. Alle bidragene er valgt, fordi de er gode til netop det de vil. Denne bredde er vi glade for og stolte over dansk rollespil kan rumme og vi håber at I vil få godt spil og gode oplevelser med scenarierne.

Bogen er ikke en indføring i, hvad rollespil er og kan, men et bredt udvalg af det bedste rollespil på dansk fra de senere år, og forudsætter derfor forhåndskendskab til mediet.

Translated from the back of the book:
Welcome to Danish roleplaying games in the year 2011.

Scenariebogen is a praise of the broadness and profundity of Danish roleplaying games.

The book you right now are holding in your hands contains nine RPG scenarios which in their own way are excellent. The subject matter covers a wide field, from the cheerful action-adventure to the adult and violent. Here is something for most and something for few. Something will be easy to start with and something will be hard to leave. here is both light experiences, and experiences that will take their toll and give food for thought. All the entries have been chosen because they are good at doing what they want to do. This broadness are we pleased with and proud of that Danish RPGs can contain and we hope you will get good games and great adventures with the scenarios.

The book is not an introduction to what roleplaying games are and can do, but a wide selection of the best RPGs in Danish in recent years, and as a result requires prior knowledge to the medium.

99596.name: The Regatta
99596.description:
Race game. There are 80 squares to move along. No rules known to exist but is probably a roll-and-move game, with rewards and forfeits depending where you land.

The board depicts the Isle of Wight Regatta

99597.name: The Game of Brer Rabbit
99597.description:
Edwardian, British card game. The cards depict events from the Uncle Remus stories in the books by Joel Chandler Harris.
The game is a mix of Snap meets Happy Families. The objective being to collect sets. Children are encouraged to cry out "Brer Rabbit" when they see a matching card, and they must also read the quotation on the card.
Note that there were two different boxes used and it is unknown which came first. The box with the red surround has slightly different graphic under the quotation. The black surround box looks like it was printed slightly later, to me, than the red one.

99598.name: Island Fish Co.
99598.description:
Fishing season and Stores want lots of fish. Out to sea we go, putting out bait, hauling in nets, watching out for Sharks, always paying attention to the weather reports. Take a risk and get that last catch in?

The four Island Stores put in orders for Fish of various kinds.
Players are members of the Island Fishing Co-op, each with their own Boat, but who work together to fill these Store Orders, and return Home safely before the Stormy Season makes fishing and deliveries too dangerous to continue. They get paid for their work and share the earnings!

Contents:

12 x 12" board,
4 fishing boats,
4 boat movers,
12 assorted fish,
4 sharks,
4 good weathers,
12 storms, and
16 assorted baits (4 are all-purpose),
the home supply depot

99599.name: 2012: The Mayan Calendar
